intro: Gymnosphaera khasyana, commonly known as the Khasi gymnosphaera, is a rare and unique plant species native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, woody, spherical structure that resembles a small tree or shrub. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers and is known for its ability to thrive in humid, tropical climates. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
